text: The 2011 Women's European Union Amateur Boxing Championships were held in the Spodek stadium in Katowice, Poland from June 6 to June 11. This was the 6th edition of this annual competition organised by the European governing body for amateur boxing, the European Boxing Confederation (EUBC). 84 fighters from 20 federations competed in 10 weight divisions. Host country Poland were convincing victors in the overall medal table, with Turkey and England each winning two golds. Ireland's Katie Taylor won her fourth straight gold in the 60 kg division. == Medal winners == {| |- | align="center"| 48 kg | Meltem Akar | Patrycja Bednarek | Lydia Boussaida Sarah Bormann |- | align="center"| 51 kg | Nicola Adams | Karolina Michalczuk | Valeria Calabrese Katalin Ancsin |- | align="center"| 54 kg | Ayşe Taş | Sandra Drabik | Delphine Mancini Csilla Nemedi |- | align="center"| 57 kg | Sandra Kruk | Svetlana Staneva | Tiina Hahl Malva Hammadouche |- | align="center"| 60 kg | Katie Taylor | Karolina Graczyk | Chantelle Cameron Mira Potkonen |- | align="center"| 64 kg | Natasha Jonas | Oliwia Łuczak | Laetitia Chevalier Oshin Derieuw |- | align="center"| 69 kg | Katarzyna Furmaniak | Marichelle de Jong | Jennifer Corti Louise Traynor |- | align="center"| 75 kg | Lidia Fidura | Nouchka Fontijn | Elif Guneri Mária Kovács |- | align="center"| 81 kg | Timea Nagy | Sylwia Kusiak | Lauragh O'Neill |- | align="center"| +81 kg | Anna Słowik | Şennur Demir | Lilla Sandor Danijela Vernic |} ==Medal count table== {| class="wikitable" |- bgcolor="#efefef" !
